articles.title: Review - k-Drama - Boombaptism
articles.description: It's been two years since k Drama dropped Behind The Glory, and it has been well worth the wait. Now, Drama has returned with the fresh Boombaptism. Essentially, BoomBaptism is exactly that � a baptism. The choral chorus line comes on before Drama drops his lyrical knowledge. It feels like K Drama could have done a little better here.  BoomBaptism is a redefinition in every sense of the word.
articles.author: Rapzilla.com

articles.title: Why Frank Zappa made me hate High School Musical
articles.description: Well, specifically Troy Bolton : he of gleaming teeth, with that curious blend of athleticism and sensitivity. The thing is, once you’ve heard the song, it’s impossible to look at Troy Bolton in the same light again. Go and check out the song and tell me if you see Mr Bolton in the same light!
articles.author: Gerard McGarry

articles.title: Seether’s Finding Beauty In Negative Spaces Doesn’t Get Enough Credit
articles.description: Seether : Finding Beauty In Negative Spaces is an album that I bought earlier this year when I took over The Rock Dose. Amongst all the Schlock or Cock rock, whatever you want to call most of it these days, Seether is a bit different in my opinion. Tags : Finding Beauty In Negative Space, seether, Shaun MorganShare This
articles.author: Scott

articles.title: The 'Gum Drop LXVIII: Hear New Appleseed Cast, Win A Crosley Turntable
articles.description: In February, longtime California to Kansas post rockers the Appleseed Cast will release their sixth studio album Sagarmatha, the first since 2006's Peregrine. Sagarmatha is out 2/17 via The Militia Group. This week we also offered the chance to win a Crosley CR40 Mini Turntable.
articles.author: Stereogum

articles.title: Peter Gabriel & Hot Chip Cover Vampire Weekend
articles.description: Naturally we all got pretty excited this summer when Peter Gabriel announced plans to cover Vampire Weekend's signature song Cape Cod Kwassa Kwassa. On this cover, Kwassa Kwassa' s squiggly riff and Congo beats are replaced with soft keys and electronic flourishes courtesy of the guys in Hot Chip. Peter's got the yelp down, though.
articles.author: Stereogum

articles.title: Update: Akon Avoids Jail Time, Pleads Guilty In Harrasment Case
articles.description: <p>Superstar crooner Akon plead guilty to harrasment today (December 17) for tossing a fan off stage during a 2007 perfomance.As previously reported, during a concert at Dutchess Stadium in Fishkill in June 2007, 15-year-old Anthony Smith threw an object at Akon while he was onstage and the singer asked the crowd to point...
articles.author: Sixshot.com Urban

articles.title: Chris Martin on Coldplay Breakup
articles.description: We have split up on this tour, he confessed to the Daily Mirror. So what qualifies as bad news in the Coldplay household?  Well, putting things into perspective, there hasn't been anything that bad for a while, Martin said.
articles.author: Matt Kiser

articles.title: No Doubt: Tour But No Album in 2009
articles.description: Sorry, No Doubt fans, you're going to have to wait for new music. [ We'll have ] a mobile studio on the bus and eventually get to a new No Doubt record. I can play reggae music to my grave.
articles.author: Matt Kiser

articles.title: Coconot
articles.description: Recording as El Guincho, Pablo Díaz Reixa crafted drum heavy, carnival esque sounds on Alegranza ( No. After a break to craft music as El Guincho, Díaz Reixa returned to Coconot -- now a trio, following Montes' departure -- to write and record what would become Cosa Astral. Listen : Coconot, Verbena de los Delfines ( DOWNLOAD MP3 )
articles.author: Matt Kiser

articles.title: Keane and Kanye Collaborate
articles.description: So it makes sense that it was the place where mutual musical appreciators Keane and Kanye West first made sweet music together. Earlier this year, Keane and Kanye shared an amazing night in the studio in Paris where they gushed about each other's work. So much, in fact, that Keane's infatuation with West hasn't dissipated.
articles.author: Matt Kiser
